Description: THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FOR MEANINGFUL TECHNICAL, LOGISTICAL, AND MANAGEMENT COORDINATION BETWEEN THE MONTANA FISH, WILDLIFE&PARKS AND USACE IN REGARDS TO THE OPERATION OF THE MURRAY SPRINGS FISH HATCHERY.

THIS PROPOSAL INCLUDES FUNDING ALLOTMENTS FOR ANNUAL OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE (O&M) OF FIVE SALMON HATCHERIES (BIG CREEK, BONNEVILLE, CASCADE, CLACKAMAS, AND OXBOW) AS AUTHORIZED BY THE MITCHELL ACT. THIS FUNDING IS PROVIDED BY NOAA FISHERIES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND COVERS NOT ONLY THE O&M SPECIFICALLY RELATING TO THESE HATCHERIES AS DETAILED IN THE BUDGET, BUT OTHER SPECIFIC TASKS (PATHOLOGY SERVICES, FISH ID AND FISH DISTRIBUTION) THAT DIRECTLY RELATE TO THE O&M OF THESE HATCHERIES.  ANNUAL PRODUCTION FROM THESE FIVE HATCHERIES IS APPROXIMATELY 10.5 MILLION FISH.  ADDITIONALLY, ANNUAL FUNDING ALLOTMENTS FOR SIX MONITORING AND EVALUATION REFORM ACTIONS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS PROGRAM.  ODFW PROJECTS ARE CONSIDERED ONGOING (MULTIPLE YEARS) EFFORTS AND INCLUDE:        LOWER COLUMBIA RIVER TULE STREAM MONITORING        LOWER COLUMBIA WILD FISH MONITORING        CODED WIRE TAG (IJ) RECOVERIES ON LOWER COLUMBIA RIVER (EXPANDED BPA FUNDING EXCHANGE)        UMATILLA RIVER BROO

SINCE 1982, COHO HAVE BEEN PLANTED ANNUALLY INTO THE YAKIMA BASIN EXCEPT FOR 1984. BETWEEN 700,000 AND 1,500,000 US. V OREGON YEARLING COHO ARE TRANSPORTED FROM LOWER COLUMBIA RIVER HATCHERIES FOR RELEASE EACH SPRING. IN ORDER TO IMPROVE SURVIVAL OF COHO TRANSPORTED INTO THE BASIN FOR RELEASE, THE YAKAMA NATION PROPOSES TO REAR AND RELEASE THESE FISH FROM STRATEGIC ACCLIMATION SITES LOCATED IN THE YAKIMA RIVER BASIN. ONE OF THE OBJECTIVE OF THESE RELEASES IS CONTRIBUTING TO A TERMINAL FISHERY. ANOTHER OBJECTIVE IS USING THIS STOCK OF COHO TO TRANSITION TO RESTORING EXTIRPATED NATURAL COHO POPULATIONS IN THE BASIN. AS A RESULT OF THIS RESTORATION GOAL, RELEASE LOCATIONS ARE CHANGING IN ORDER TO STRATEGICALLY ACCLIMATE THE COHO IN NATURAL PRODUCTION AREAS.

CURRENT EFFORTS TO RESTORE COHO SALMON IN THE CLEARWATER RIVER SUB-BASIN RELY HEAVILY UPON RELEASES BASED SOLELY ON ADULT RETURNS TO THE CLEARWATER BASIN. LIMITED STAFFING DUE TO BUDGET CONSTRAINTS WAS HINDERING OUR ABILITY TO FULLY TRANSITION TO LOCAL BROODSTOCK. FUNDING FROM MITCHELL ACT HAS ALLOWED US TO INCREASE OUR LOCALIZED CLEARWATER RIVER STOCK RELEASES. IN ADDITION, BOOST OUR MONITORING AND EVALUATION OF THE PROGRAM IS BEING PERFORMED, AND WHAT LITTLE IS BEING COLLECTED IS NOT ANALYZED/REPORTED. WITH THIS PROPOSAL WE ARE SEEKING FUNDING TO: 1) ADDITIONAL STAFFING AND SUPPLIES FOR BROOD STOCK COLLECTION AND SPAWNING; AND 2) SUPPORT ONE FTE RESEARCH BIOLOGIST TO IMPLEMENT ASPECTS OF THE CLEARWATER COHO REINTRODUCTION MONITORING AND EVALUATION PLAN (CHAPTER 5 IN MASTER PLAN) ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLLECTION, ANALYSIS AND REPORTING OF HATCHERY PRODUCTION PERFORMANCE.

PROJECT #1: THREE STATE IMW PROJECT THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR THE COMMISSION TO WORK COOPERATIVELY WITH NMFS, WA, OR, AND ID TO IDENTIFY APPROPRIATE SITES AND DESIGN FOR RESEARCH MONITORING AND EVALUATION PROJECTS THAT FOCUS ON SEVERAL SELECTED WATERSHEDS TO DETERMINE THE EFFECTS OF REGULATORY AND RESTORATION ACTION OF SALMON RECOVERY AND WATERSHED CONDITIONS.    PROJECT #2: KLAMATH BASIN FISHERIES PROGRAM COORDINATION PROVIDE  FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE (ODFW) TO SUPPORT 2 YEARS OF FUNDING TO MAINTAIN THE KLAMATH BASIN FISHERIES PROGRAM COORDINATOR POSITION DURING A FUNDING SHORTFALL.         THE POSITION IS THE PRIMARY LEAD FOR COMPLETING THE MULTI-AGENCY (INCLUDING NMFS) UPPER BASIN REINTRODUCTION PLAN,        THE POSITION WILL OVERSEE AND IMPLEMENT THE ODFW PRE- AND POST-DAM REMOVAL ANADROMOUS FISH REINTRODUCTION EVALUATION AND MONITORING.        THIS POSITION IS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSEEING, IN CLOSE COLLABORATION WITH NMFS
THE MITCHELL ACT FALL CHINOOK AND COHO ACCLIMATION PROJECT - REPROGRAMMING LOWER COLUMBIA RIVER HATCHERY FISH TO THE YAKIMA RIVER
KLICKITAT HATCHERY O&M TO PRODUCE MITCHELL ACT SALMON TO MEET TRIBAL AND NON-TRIBAL FISHING OBLIGATIONS TO THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST.  MAINTAIN FISHWAYS TO ENSURE ESCAPEMENT TO NATURAL PRODUCTION AREAS.
